name: Energy
description: Total daily energy (calories). Calculated from user's age, sex, weight, height, and activity level using Mifflin-St Jeor equation.
calculation_note: Base TEE from equation + pregnancy increment if applicable
importance_pregnancy: Energy needs increase in T2 (+340 kcal/day) and T3 (+452 kcal/day)

name: Protein
description: Essential for tissue building, enzymes, hormones, and immune function.
importance_pregnancy: Critical for fetal growth, placenta development, and increased blood volume. RDA increases from 46g to 71g/day.

name: Carbohydrate
description: Primary energy source for body and brain. Minimum needed to spare protein and prevent ketosis.
importance_pregnancy: Minimum increases from 130g to 175g/day. Glucose is the primary fuel for fetal brain development.

name: Total Fat
description: Essential for hormone production, nutrient absorption (A, D, E, K), and cell membranes.
calculation_note: Target is 20-35% of total energy (AMDR). Grams calculated from energy target.
importance_pregnancy: Essential fatty acids critical for fetal brain and eye development.

name: Dietary Fiber
description: Supports digestive health, blood sugar control, and cholesterol management.
importance_pregnancy: Helps prevent constipation (common in pregnancy). AI increases to 28g/day.

name: Total Water
description: From all beverages and foods. Essential for all body functions.
importance_pregnancy: Needs increase to 3.0 L/day to support expanded blood volume and amniotic fluid.

name: Omega-3 (ALA)
description: Alpha-linolenic acid. Essential fatty acid the body cannot make.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases from 1.1g to 1.4g/day. Precursor for longer-chain omega-3s (EPA/DHA).

name: DHA (Omega-3)
description: Docosahexaenoic acid. Long-chain omega-3 critical for brain and retinal tissue.
importance_pregnancy: Target 200-300mg/day for fetal brain and retinal development. Most critical in T3 when brain grows rapidly.

name: EPA (Omega-3)
description: Eicosapentaenoic acid. Long-chain omega-3 with anti-inflammatory properties.
importance_pregnancy: Supports cardiovascular health and may help reduce preterm birth risk. Often consumed with DHA.

name: Folate (DFE)
description: B vitamin essential for DNA synthesis and cell division. DFE = Dietary Folate Equivalents.
importance_pregnancy: CRITICAL. Prevents neural tube defects. RDA increases from 400μg to 600μg DFE. Supplementation recommended before and during early pregnancy.
upper_limit_note: UL of 1000μg applies to synthetic folic acid from supplements/fortified foods, not food folate.

name: Vitamin B12
description: Essential for nerve function, DNA synthesis, and red blood cell formation.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 2.4μg to 2.6μg. Deficiency can cause neural tube defects and developmental issues. Vegans require supplementation.

name: Iron
description: Essential for hemoglobin (oxygen transport) and many enzymes.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases dramatically from 18mg to 27mg/day. Supports 50% increase in blood volume and fetal iron stores. Deficiency causes anemia.
absorption_note: Heme iron (animal sources) better absorbed. Vitamin C enhances non-heme absorption.

name: Calcium
description: Essential for bones, teeth, muscle function, and nerve signaling.
importance_pregnancy: RDA stays at 1000mg (1300mg for teens). Fetal skeleton requires ~30g calcium total. If intake is low, calcium is mobilized from maternal bones.

name: Vitamin D
description: Essential for calcium absorption, bone health, and immune function. 1μg = 40 IU.
importance_pregnancy: RDA is 15μg (600 IU). Deficiency linked to preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, and low birth weight. Many women are deficient.

name: Iodine
description: Essential for thyroid hormone production.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 150μg to 220μg. Critical for fetal brain development. Severe deficiency causes cretinism.

name: Zinc
description: Essential for immune function, protein synthesis, wound healing, and DNA synthesis.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 8mg to 11-12mg. Important for fetal growth and development.

name: Choline
description: Essential for cell membrane structure, neurotransmitter synthesis, and gene expression.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases from 425mg to 450mg. Critical for fetal brain development and may reduce neural tube defect risk. Often under-consumed.

name: Vitamin A (RAE)
description: Essential for vision, immune function, and cell differentiation. RAE = Retinol Activity Equivalents.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 700μg to 750-770μg. Important for fetal development. CAUTION: Excess preformed vitamin A (retinol) is teratogenic.
upper_limit_note: UL of 3000μg applies to preformed retinol, not beta-carotene from plants.

name: Vitamin C
description: Antioxidant, essential for collagen synthesis, immune function, and iron absorption.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 75mg to 85mg. Supports placental development and iron absorption.

name: Vitamin E
description: Antioxidant protecting cell membranes from oxidative damage.
importance_pregnancy: RDA stays at 15mg. Supports immune function and may protect against preeclampsia.

name: Vitamin K
description: Essential for blood clotting and bone metabolism.
importance_pregnancy: AI stays at 90μg. Newborns receive vitamin K injection due to low stores at birth.

name: Thiamin (B1)
description: Essential for energy metabolism and nerve function.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 1.1mg to 1.4mg. Supports increased energy metabolism.

name: Riboflavin (B2)
description: Essential for energy metabolism and cellular function.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 1.1mg to 1.4mg.

name: Niacin (B3)
description: Essential for energy metabolism. NE = Niacin Equivalents (includes conversion from tryptophan).
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 14mg to 18mg NE.
upper_limit_note: UL applies to supplemental niacin (can cause flushing).

name: Vitamin B6
description: Essential for protein metabolism, neurotransmitter synthesis, and immune function.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 1.3mg to 1.9mg. May help reduce nausea in early pregnancy.

name: Magnesium
description: Essential for muscle and nerve function, blood sugar control, and bone health.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 310-320mg to 350-360mg. May help prevent preeclampsia and preterm labor.

name: Phosphorus
description: Essential for bones, teeth, and energy metabolism (ATP).
importance_pregnancy: RDA stays at 700mg (1250mg for teens). Works with calcium for bone development.

name: Potassium
description: Essential for fluid balance, muscle contractions, and nerve signals.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases from 2600mg to 2900mg. Helps regulate blood pressure.

name: Sodium
description: Essential for fluid balance and nerve function. Most people consume excess.
importance_pregnancy: General limit of 2300mg/day applies. Not restricted in normal pregnancy unless hypertension present.

name: Selenium
description: Antioxidant and essential for thyroid function.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 55μg to 60μg.

name: Copper
description: Essential for iron metabolism, connective tissue, and energy production.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 900μg to 1000μg.

name: Manganese
description: Essential for bone formation, metabolism, and antioxidant function.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases from 1.8mg to 2.0mg.

name: Chromium
description: Enhances insulin action for blood sugar regulation.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases to 30μg. May be relevant for gestational diabetes risk.

name: Molybdenum
description: Cofactor for several enzymes in amino acid metabolism.
importance_pregnancy: RDA increases from 45μg to 50μg.

name: Chloride
description: Essential for fluid balance and stomach acid production.
importance_pregnancy: AI is 2300mg/day.

name: Fluoride
description: Supports dental health and bone structure.
importance_pregnancy: AI is 3mg/day. Fetal teeth begin forming in utero.

name: Pantothenic Acid (B5)
description: Essential for synthesis of coenzyme A, required for metabolism.
importance_pregnancy: AI increases from 5mg to 6mg.

name: Biotin (B7)
description: Essential for metabolism of fats, carbohydrates, and proteins.
importance_pregnancy: AI is 30μg. Marginal deficiency may be common in pregnancy.
